intro: Silene kingii, commonly known as King's campion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has hairy, branching stems. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, often covered in fine hairs. Silene kingii is also known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions, making it a resilient species in its native range.
